subcategories.title: Price labels are missing/prices are unreadable

blockingInfo.content:
However, the prices must be clearly indicated so that you know them before buying.
For example, it is permitted to sell a bottle of water at 8 euros or a baguette at 5 euros. It's the responsability of the consumer to take a good look at the prices before buying.

Did you know ?

There are a few exceptions to this principle. Some prices are regulated, i.e. they are supervised by the law.
For example, the price of books is regulated.

A merchant does not have the right to sell at too low a price: he cannot sell a product cheaper than what it cost him. There are a few situations where he has the right to sell below the purchase price, such as the sales period.
blockingInfo.title: Companies have the right to choose their prices.

blockingInfo.content:
For example, if the date is April 13, it is possible to sell the produced on April 13 but not on April 14.
The merchant can choose to make a price reduction for "short" dates but this is not a obligation.
The merchant can indicate that the products expire soon or the same day but it is not an obligation.

subcategories.title: Products sold in the fresh section, in particular with eggs, meat or fish

blockingInfo.content:
Products sold at room temperature such as compotes, biscuits or preserves have a date called the date of minimum durability (formerly called DLUO).

The company has the right to sell a product with this date passed.

This date is only an indication. Beyond this, the food may lose some of its taste or nutritional qualities but can be consumed without danger for health. It is not necessary to throw it away.

questions.answer: Contact your store's customer service department directly for their explain.

blockingInfo.content:
Products sold at room temperature such as compotes, chocolate, biscuits or preserves have a date called the durability date minimum (formerly BBD).

The company has the right to sell a product with this date passed.
This date is only an indication. Beyond this, the food can lose some of its taste or nutritional qualities but can be consumed without danger to health. It is not necessary to throw it away.

questions.answer:
You may contact the brand's customer service.
Usually it is indicated on the packaging.
If not, contact your merchant in order to inform him of your opinion or your dissatisfaction.
questions.question: You bought your product in a store?

questions.answer:
If you find that the dish is not fresh or not hot enough, you can ask for the dish to be replaced.
If your wine is corked, you can ask to change it.
However, if your dish does not suit you for a matter of taste only, the restorer is free to take it back or not.
questions.question: Did you order your product from a bar or restaurant ?

blockingInfo.content:
Your product is no longer covered by the basic guarantee, called the "warranty legal conformity".
The legal guarantee of conformity is 2 years for all new products and 6 months for all used products. It does not apply to purchases between individuals.

questions.answer:
It is up to you to prove the existence of the hidden defect, with a report of expertise, for example.
You have two years from the discovery of this defect to make the request.
questions.question:
Do you want to sue the company for "hidden defects"?

A latent defect in a product is a defect:
  • which renders the unusable product,
  • present from the start and
  • that you did not know when you purchased the product.

Dangerous product

title: In-store purchases

description: Price, promotion, quality, weight, warranty, delivery issues, etc.
seoDescription: You had a price, promotion or quality problem when purchasing on the Internet. You have not received your order or it is damaged, customer service is unreachable or unsatisfactory...

subcategories.desc: Examples: misleading advertisements, mandatory information missing
Examples: false product description, false promises on product origin, results, environmental impact, permanent unavailability, fake stock on display, fake promotion countdowns, etc.
subcategories.title: False or misleading advertising

subcategories.desc: Examples: I am not told that it is a subscription, I get no information about cooling-off periods, I am not told how much it costs to return items.
subcategories.title: Lack of information before placing an order
The website itself

subcategories.desc: Examples: no price information given, false price discounts, sales, promotions

detailInputs.label: Please specify
Date of discovery of the incident
Description

subcategories.title: Price labels are missing/prices are unreadable

blockingInfo.content:
However, the prices must be clearly indicated so that you know them before buying.
For example, it is permitted to sell a bottle of water at 8 euros or a baguette at 5 euros. It is the consumer's responsability to take a good look at the prices before buying.

Did you know ?

There are a few exceptions to this principle. Some prices are regulated, i.e. they are supervised by the law.
For example, the price of books is regulated.

A merchant does not have the right to sell at too low a price: he cannot sell a product cheaper than what it cost him. There are a few situations where he has the right to sell below the purchase price, such as the sales period.
blockingInfo.title: Companies have the right to choose their prices.

subcategories.desc: Examples: fake promotions, false time limits

detailInputs.label: Date of discovery of the incident
Description

subcategories.title: False or misleading reduction in price

subcategories.desc: Examples: I bought shoes for €19, but my account statement indicates that I paid €29. I ordered an item, they take a payment for a subscription I didn't want, the company added extra charges without notifying me.
subcategories.title: Hidden subscriptions, additional hidden fees
Price

subcategories.desc: Examples: order never arrives, delivery delay, incomplete order or damaged items.
Example: I placed the order a month ago and I get no update on the site.
subcategories.title: Order never arrives and the French website is still open

subcategories.desc: Example: I ordered two phones, but I only received one and the company refuses to l the delivery.
subcategories.title: Incomplete order

subcategories.desc: Example: I was promised delivery in 10 days or less, I got my item six months later.
subcategories.title: Late delivery or lost parcel

subcategories.desc: Example: I received a broken chair in a parcel that had been ripped open.
subcategories.title: Item damaged in transit

subcategories.desc: Example: customer services promised a refund, I did not receive anything and customer services insist that the payment went through.
subcategories.title: Customer services have stopped responding
Placed order

subcategories.desc: Examples: product does not match the description, issue with quality or quantity / volume

subcategories.title: The product does not match the description

subcategories.desc: Example: I ordered 500 gr of chocolate, I receive 300 gr
subcategories.title: Quantity or volume issue
Product

subcategories.desc: Examples: toy, cosmetics

blockingInfo.content:
Unfortunately, we are unable to dig deeper into your report.
Although we believe the problem you encountered was real, it was not a case of fraud. That is a customer relations issue.
We recommend contacting the manager directly to let them know of your dissatisfaction.

questions.answer:
You can file a preliminary complaint online at the following website
pre-plainte-en-ligne.gouv.fr

blockingInfo.content:
A company can refuse the presence of a dog in his establishment (hotel, store, restaurant...).
If you want to be able to take your dog with you, remember to ask if dogs are accepted when making your reservation.

There are websites that list establishments (hotels, restaurants) that accept dogs.

If the quality of the products did not meet your expectations, we encourage you to contact the establishment directly, especially its customer service. Customer service is present in most restaurants and bars that are part of a group or chain. It is designed to handle such complaints.

You cannot file a report on SignalConso because Fraud Control will not be able to process your complaint.

description: Cancellation, delay, plane, train, boat, taxi or ride-hailing service, hotel, campsite, show, gym, …
seoDescription: You have a problem of cancellation, delay, refund concerning a reservation of a plane ticket, train, boat, taxi, ride-hailing service, hotel, campsite or a baggage problem
seoTitle: Report a problem of stay, flight, trip

subcategories.desc: Taxis can be spotted by the illuminated sign on the roof of the vehicle. Vehicles that do not have this sign are not "real" taxis.
subcategories.title: Taxi

subcategories.desc: Ride-hailing services do not have any specific sign on the vehicle. They must be pre-booked. In most cases, this is done online.
subcategories.title: Ride-hailing service

blockingInfo.content: When a vehicle is not identifiable as "official" (i.e. no illuminated sign on the roof, no identification number on the vehicle) or you did not book it, this is usually an illicit or "fake" taxi. So-called "fake" taxis are banned. They often call out "Taxi! Taxi!" in busy areas such as airport arrivals, or close to popular nightspots.

questions.answer: You must contact the police or the gendarmerie as soon as possible.
questions.question: What should I do if I have a problem with a "fake" taxi ?

blockingInfo.title: These are undeclared drivers ("fake" or illicit taxis).

blockingInfo.content:
Professionals have the right to choose their prices.
However, the prices must be clearly indicated so that you are aware before to buy or order.

blockingInfo.content:
You booked your flight ticket directly with an airline.
You encountered an issue with downgrading, denied boarding, or your flight was delayed or cancelled. SignalConso does not handle this type of report. We recommend you visit the French Civil Aviation Authority website:
https://droits-passagers-aeriens.aviation-civile.gouv.fr

Did you book your flight through a travel agency ?
Go back and select "Travel agency" :)

blockingInfo.content:
However, the prices must be clearly indicated so that you know them before buying.
For example, it is permitted to sell a bottle of water at 8 euros or a baguette at 5 euros. It is the consumer's responsability to take a good look at the prices before buying.

Did you know ?

There are a few exceptions to this principle. Some prices are regulated, i.e. they are supervised by the law.
For example, the price of books is regulated.

A merchant does not have the right to sell at too low a price: he cannot sell a product cheaper than what it cost him. There are a few situations where he has the right to sell below the purchase price, such as the sales period.
blockingInfo.title: Companies have the right to choose their prices.
